page.title: 03FARMING (continued)
page.content: Sheep are also raised in Golden Cross. They are kept in a grazing field near to the church in small quantities and are also sold in Hailsham and Lewes. There are other profitable sidelines in the area. Many farms keep a few chickens in a small field and sell the eggs produced as Â£free range eggs' and can sell them at a higher price. There is itensive animal farming in the area and the animals are well treated. The soil in the area is very good for farming. It is not very rocky and is flat so machines can be used easily. It is very rich in vital nutrients and very little fertilizer has to be used which lowers the cost per acre. Overall the farming is arable and the site is very good for farming.
